name: Air Tank (TL 5)
description:
A complete set of air reservoirs and the appropriate breathing mask to allow independent breathing in smoke, dust, gas, or exotic atmospheres.

The tanks are filled with 2 hours of the appropriate breathing gases (for example, Air-4, Air-8) for the user. This apparatus can be used underwater. Also enables compressed-air-driven tool usage. Storage unit is typically coded to the air stored; for example, Air-6 for standard O-CO2-N human-breathable air, Air-9 for sophonts who breathe dense, tainted air, and so on. The size and composition of the storage medium depends largely on the tech level: lower tech levels store air in glass or metallic bottles, while higher tech levels may store it in more compact ceramic sponges, and so on.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Air Tank IN / 374
description: IN / 374 stainless steel air receiver tank with carbon steel support. The tanks are filled with 100 hours of the appropriate breathing gases (for example, Air-4, Air-8) for the user. This apparatus can be used underwa- ter. Also enables compressed-air-driven tool usage. Storage unit is typically coded to the air stored; for example, Air-6 for standard O-CO2-N human-breathable air, Air-9 for sophonts who breathe dense, tainted air, and so on. The size and composition of the storage medium depends largely on the tech level: lower tech levels store air in glass or metallic bottles, while higher tech levels may store it in more compact ceramic sponges, and so on.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Atmospheric Sponge
description:
The Atmospheric Sponge is a typical TL H life support component. Primarily sold on the starship and space station market, it also can be used in the housing, vehicle and terraforming industry.

The Atmospheric Sponge contains a nanofoam that scrubs the atmosphere of irritants, bacteria, most viruses, and harmful gases. The Atmospheric Sponge can be powered by any source of electrical energy. When connected to on board power they can run with only minimal expense. Each Sponge can support up 100 tons of Life Support needs for one year before needing maintenance.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Breather (TL 7)
description: The breather removes waste gases and recycles breathing gases to the user. The breather uses a PowerCell-2 and has a duration of one day, after which it also requires routine maintenance.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Combination Mask (TL 5)
description: The combination mask is a breathing apparatus combining a filter and a respirator that allows breathing Air-2 and Air-5 and is only effective against T (Poison).

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Filter Mask (TL 3)
description: The filter mask is a breathing filter which protects against taint in Air-7 and Air-9 and is effective only against T (Poison).

name: Gill
description: The gill is a breathing apparatus for air breathers which extracts oxygen from water.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Rebreather
description: The rebreather is an improved version of the breather for better performance and efficiency.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Respirator (TL 5)
description: The respirator is a small compressor allowing breathing in Air-3 (Vthin Atmosphere). An alternative name is Compressor.

name: Surface Water Tank
description: Similar in concept to air storage units, surface “water tanks” are for water-breathing sophonts, and may include pumps, circulators, air mixers, etc.
